Metadata: Carbohydrate dynamics and the crustacean hyperglycemic hormone (CHH): effects of parasitic infection in Norway lobsters ("Nephrops norvegicus")

In this study scientists investigated the effect of progressive infection of the Norway lobster by "Hematodinium" parasites on the plasma titer of the crustacean hyperglycemic hormone as a possible sensitive indicator of stress. They examine whether these changes may be implicated in the altered plasma glucose and tissue glycogen concentrations that often accompany these infestations.
